intro: Duguetia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical regions.
